p: Securidaca longepedunculata produced concentration-dependent significant activities from 3 μg/ml on U87 and 10 μg/ml on U251 cell lines 48 h after treatment. When these extracts were tested for their effects on invasion using collagen V-coated membrane, all extracts significantly ( p < 0.05) inhibited the invasion of U251 cell line within 8 h of invasion with A. inermis and S. longepedunculata producing greatest effects. The effects of the extracts on proliferation and invasion may be why the plants are useful to TMPs in the management of cancers. The previous study conducted showed that S. longepedunculata root aqueous extract has cytotoxic effects on Ehrlich ascites carcinoma with IC 50 of 67 μg/ml [ 21] which is much higher than the results from this study with IC 50 of 8 and 20 μg/ml on U87 and U251, respectively.
